availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Jackson Elliott (Louisville, Kentucky, city attorney and councilman)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, city attorney and councilman. Kentucky native. Son of William Elliott and Eliza Fowke Elliot. Married to Nancy O'Neal Elliott in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on January 13, 1847. Father of John William Elliott, Eliza Fowke Elliott, and Nancy Eliza Elliott. Married to Annie C. VanOrten Elliott in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on May 16, 1855. Father of Edwin J. Elliott, Nellie Elliott, Kate Elliott, Hattie Elliott, Robert J. Elliott, Jr., and Annie L. Elliott. Graduate of Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1846. Admitted to the bar in 1847. Attorney in Louisville in 1850. Served in the Washington Blues Company of the Louisville Legion from 1851 to 1852. City attorney of Louisville from 1855 to 1861. Partner with Edwin S. Craig in the law firm of Craig & Elliott in Louisville from 1859 to 1861. Member of the City Council of Louisville from 1863 to 1864. Attorney in Louisville in 1863. Assistant city attorney of Louisville from 1864 to 1868.
